intro: Dicliptera cordibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of compact clusters of spikelets, which are often covered in fine hairs. Dicliptera cordibracteata is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in savanna and woodland habitats.
